org.jparfor

Class JParFor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jparfor.JParFor

  • public class JParFor
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains implementation of main methods Parallel FOR.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_THREADS
      Minimal sizes of images when create many threads no needed.

      Minimum iterations into one thread by default.

      Run single loop into many threads.
      static void exec(int end, JLoop runner)
      Same exec(int, int, int, JLoop), but use begin = 0 and step = 1: for (int i = 0; i < end; ++i) { runner.exec(i, 0); // Do something... }

      • exec

        public static void exec(int begin,
                        int end,
                        int step,
                        JLoop runner)
        Run single loop into many threads.

        Same as: 

         for (int i = begin; i < end; i += step) {
      runner.exec(i, 0); // Do something...
 }

        To save results of the threads use following pattern: 

         final double[] results = new double[JParfor.getMaxWorkers()];
 JParfor.exec(begin, end, step, new Runner() {
       @Override
      public void execute(int i, int nThread) {
          // Perform some calculations.
          // nThread starts from 0!
          // temp -- some result.
          results[nThread] = temp;
      }
 });

        Parameters:
        begin - Start index.
        end - End index.
        step - Increment value.
        runner - Operation that will be executed on each step.

      • exec

        public static void exec(int end,
                        JLoop runner)
        Same exec(int, int, int, JLoop), but use begin = 0 and step = 1: 
         for (int i = 0; i < end; ++i) {
      runner.exec(i, 0); // Do something...
 }
        Parameters:
        end - End index.
        runner - Operation that will be executed on each step.
